About Me

I'm a software engineer, designer, and writer living in the San Francisco Bay Area.

I like to create things. Especially things that help people.

My goal is to find a job or internship that makes the most of my technical, design, and writing skills to create useful software that makes a positive impact.

I believe that technology offers amazing avenues to connect, educate, and inspire. My hope is that I can contribute to a great company with projects that do exactly that.

I'm currently finishing a B.S. in Computer Science and am excited to apply my new knowledge to new opportunities.

Get In Touch »

I'm always excited to learn and help others learn.

Currently enrolled at Oregon State University, I'm planning to earn my B.S. in Computer Science in 2019. I also graduated from UC Berkeley with a B.A. in Rhetoric and American Studies, cum laude.

In between my degrees, I worked as a nonprofit fundraiser and grant writer for Bay Area nonprofits that helped students in underserved schools and low-income families in need of food.

While working for these organizations and volunteering as a literacy tutor, I became aware of the technology's potential in solving community issues like educational inequity.

I always enjoyed tinkering with web development, so why not take the next step? You can see what I've been building recently under Projects.

Check Out My Projects »

In my spare time, I like to explore, think, and be involved in my community.

While studying computer science, I spent all of 2018 traveling around the world, visiting ten countries. I enjoyed swimming in Iceland and Australia, hiking all over New Zealand and the UK, eating everything in Japan and Spain, and meeting friends, old and new. (By the way, I took the photo on the front page of this website, while hiking near the England-Wales border.)

At home, I co-faciliate a book club that rereads children's literature and am on the board of an LGBT square dancing club. I'm also into orienteering, film, and volunteering -- I've been a literacy tutor and a college application counselor.
